prompt: What was the best part of today?
quote: Enjoy the little things, for one day you may look back and realize they were the big things.
author: Robert Brault

prompt: What made me smile today?
quote: A warm smile is the universal language of kindness.
author: William Arthur Ward

prompt: What am I grateful for today?
quote: Gratitude turns what we have into enough.
author: Melody Beattie

prompt: What drained my energy today?
quote: The energy of the mind is the essence of life.
author: Aristotle

prompt: What gave me energy today?
quote: Energy and persistence conquer all things.
author: Benjamin Franklin

prompt: What did I learn today?
quote: Live as if you were to die tomorrow. Learn as if you were to live forever.
author: Mahatma Gandhi

prompt: What would I do differently if I could repeat today?
quote: We do not learn from experience... we learn from reflecting on experience.
author: John Dewey

prompt: Who did I help today?
quote: The best way to find yourself is to lose yourself in the service of others.
author: Mahatma Gandhi

prompt: What challenged me today?
quote: The greater the obstacle, the more glory in overcoming it.
author: Molière

prompt: What am I proud of from today?
quote: Take pride in how far you've come. Have faith in how far you can go.
author: Unknown

prompt: What did I avoid today that I should face tomorrow?
quote: The cave you fear to enter holds the treasure you seek.
author: Joseph Campbell

prompt: What moment today will I remember?
quote: Life is not measured by the number of breaths we take, but by the moments that take our breath away.
author: Maya Angelou

prompt: What surprised me today?
quote: The only way to make sense out of change is to plunge into it, move with it, and join the dance.
author: Alan Watts

prompt: How did I show up for myself today?
quote: Self-care is not selfish. You cannot serve from an empty vessel.
author: Eleanor Brown

prompt: What conversation mattered most today?
quote: One good conversation can shift the direction of change forever.
author: Linda Lambert

prompt: What did I rush through that deserved more attention?
quote: The present moment is filled with joy and happiness. If you are attentive, you will see it.
author: Thích Nhất Hạnh

prompt: What made me feel most alive today?
quote: The purpose of life is to live it, to taste experience to the utmost.
author: Eleanor Roosevelt

prompt: What did I do today that aligned with my values?
quote: Your beliefs become your thoughts, your thoughts become your words.
author: Mahatma Gandhi

prompt: What did I do today that didn't align with my values?
quote: Integrity is choosing courage over comfort.
author: Brené Brown

prompt: How was I kind to myself today?
quote: Talk to yourself like you would to someone you love.
author: Brené Brown

prompt: How was I kind to others today?
quote: No act of kindness, no matter how small, is ever wasted.
author: Aesop

prompt: What did I notice today that I usually overlook?
quote: The real voyage of discovery consists not in seeking new landscapes, but in having new eyes.
author: Marcel Proust

prompt: What assumption was I wrong about today?
quote: The greatest discovery of all time is that a person can change their future by merely changing their attitude.
author: Oprah Winfrey

prompt: What boundary did I set or fail to set today?
quote: Daring to set boundaries is about having the courage to love ourselves.
author: Brené Brown

prompt: What made me anxious today?
quote: Anxiety does not empty tomorrow of its sorrows, but only empties today of its strength.
author: Charles Spurgeon

prompt: What brought me peace today?
quote: Peace comes from within. Do not seek it without.
author: Buddha

prompt: What did I accomplish today that I didn't expect to?
quote: The secret of getting ahead is getting started.
author: Mark Twain

prompt: What distracted me today?
quote: The successful warrior is the average man, with laser-like focus.
author: Bruce Lee

prompt: When did I feel most present today?
quote: Wherever you are, be all there.
author: Jim Elliot

prompt: What did I resist today, and why?
quote: What you resist persists.
author: Carl Jung

prompt: Who inspired me today?
quote: Surround yourself with people who inspire you.
author: Unknown

prompt: What did I create today?
quote: Creativity is intelligence having fun.
author: Albert Einstein

prompt: What opportunity did I miss today?
quote: In the middle of difficulty lies opportunity.
author: Albert Einstein

prompt: What opportunity did I seize today?
quote: Opportunities don't happen. You create them.
author: Chris Grosser

prompt: How did I handle frustration today?
quote: Between stimulus and response there is a space. In that space is our power to choose our response.
author: Viktor Frankl

prompt: What made me laugh today?
quote: Laughter is the shortest distance between two people.
author: Victor Borge

prompt: What did I worry about that never happened?
quote: Worry is like a rocking chair: it gives you something to do but never gets you anywhere.
author: Erma Bombeck

prompt: What small win can I celebrate from today?
quote: Success is the sum of small efforts repeated day in and day out.
author: Robert Collier

prompt: What negative thought did I let dominate today?
quote: You are not your thoughts. You are the observer of your thoughts.
author: Unknown

prompt: What positive thought can I carry into tomorrow?
quote: Once you replace negative thoughts with positive ones, you'll start having positive results.
author: Willie Nelson

prompt: How did I practice patience today?
quote: Patience is not the ability to wait, but the ability to keep a good attitude while waiting.
author: Joyce Meyer

prompt: Where did I lack patience today?
quote: Rivers know this: there is no hurry. We shall get there some day.
author: A.A. Milne

prompt: What compliment did I receive today?
quote: Accept compliments graciously. A simple thank you is more than enough.
author: Unknown

prompt: What compliment did I give today?
quote: Kind words can be short and easy to speak, but their echoes are truly endless.
author: Mother Teresa

prompt: What did I do today just for me?
quote: Self-care is giving the world the best of you, instead of what's left of you.
author: Katie Reed

prompt: What commitment did I keep today?
quote: Commitment is doing the thing you said you were going to do long after the mood you said it in has left you.
author: Unknown

prompt: What commitment did I break today?
quote: Mistakes are proof that you are trying.
author: Unknown

prompt: How was my energy level today compared to yesterday?
quote: Energy is the currency of life. Spend it wisely.
author: Unknown

prompt: What habit served me well today?
quote: We are what we repeatedly do. Excellence, then, is not an act, but a habit.
author: Aristotle

prompt: What habit undermined me today?
quote: The chains of habit are too weak to be felt until they are too strong to be broken.
author: Samuel Johnson

prompt: What did I eat today and how did it make me feel?
quote: Let food be thy medicine and medicine be thy food.
author: Hippocrates

prompt: How much water did I drink today?
quote: Water is the driving force of all nature.
author: Leonardo da Vinci

prompt: How well did I sleep last night, and how did it affect today?
quote: Sleep is the golden chain that ties health and our bodies together.
author: Thomas Dekker

prompt: What physical discomfort did I experience today?
quote: The body is your temple. Keep it pure and clean for the soul to reside in.
author: B.K.S. Iyengar

prompt: When did I feel most connected to others today?
quote: Connection is why we're here. It's what gives purpose and meaning to our lives.
author: Brené Brown

prompt: When did I feel most disconnected today?
quote: We're all islands shouting lies to each other across seas of misunderstanding.
author: Rudyard Kipling

prompt: What technology added value to my day?
quote: Technology is best when it brings people together.
author: Matt Mullenweg

prompt: What technology wasted my time today?
quote: The cost of a thing is the amount of life which is required to be exchanged for it.
author: Henry David Thoreau

prompt: What did I say no to today?
quote: You can be a good person with a kind heart and still say no.
author: Lori Deschene

prompt: What did I say yes to today?
quote: When you say yes to others, make sure you are not saying no to yourself.
author: Paulo Coelho

prompt: What triggered stress for me today?
quote: It's not stress that kills us, it is our reaction to it.
author: Hans Selye

prompt: How did I manage stress today?
quote: You must learn to let go. Release the stress. You were never in control anyway.
author: Steve Maraboli

prompt: What made me feel valued today?
quote: The greatest good you can do for another is not just to share your riches but to reveal to him his own.
author: Benjamin Disraeli

prompt: What made me feel invisible today?
quote: The worst distance between two people is misunderstanding.
author: Unknown

prompt: What did I postpone today?
quote: Procrastination is the art of keeping up with yesterday.
author: Don Marquis

prompt: What did I complete today that I've been putting off?
quote: The way to get started is to quit talking and begin doing.
author: Walt Disney

prompt: What risk did I take today?
quote: Do one thing every day that scares you.
author: Eleanor Roosevelt

prompt: What risk did I avoid today?
quote: The biggest risk is not taking any risk.
author: Mark Zuckerberg

prompt: How did I react to criticism today?
quote: Criticism, like rain, should be gentle enough to nourish a person's growth without destroying their roots.
author: Frank A. Clark

prompt: What feedback did I give today?
quote: Feedback is the breakfast of champions.
author: Ken Blanchard

prompt: What did I do today that future me will thank me for?
quote: Someone is sitting in the shade today because someone planted a tree long ago.
author: Warren Buffett

prompt: What did I do today that future me will regret?
quote: In the end, we only regret the chances we didn't take.
author: Lewis Carroll

prompt: How did my morning set the tone for the day?
quote: How you start your day is how you live your day. How you live your day is how you live your life.
author: Louise Hay

prompt: What was my mood throughout the day?
quote: You can't stop the waves, but you can learn to surf.
author: Jon Kabat-Zinn

prompt: What made me feel in control today?
quote: You are not a drop in the ocean. You are the entire ocean in a drop.
author: Rumi

prompt: What made me feel out of control today?
quote: Life is 10% what happens to you and 90% how you react to it.
author: Charles R. Swindoll

prompt: What beauty did I notice today?
quote: The world is full of magic things, patiently waiting for our senses to grow sharper.
author: W.B. Yeats

prompt: What movement or exercise did I do today?
quote: Take care of your body. It's the only place you have to live.
author: Jim Rohn

prompt: How present was I in my conversations today?
quote: Most people do not listen with the intent to understand; they listen with the intent to reply.
author: Stephen R. Covey

prompt: What made me feel creative today?
quote: Creativity takes courage.
author: Henri Matisse

prompt: What routine anchored my day today?
quote: The secret of your future is hidden in your daily routine.
author: Mike Murdock

prompt: What broke my routine today?
quote: Life is what happens when you're busy making other plans.
author: John Lennon

prompt: How did I show leadership today?
quote: Leadership is not about being in charge. It's about taking care of those in your charge.
author: Simon Sinek

prompt: What conflict did I navigate today?
quote: Peace is not the absence of conflict, but the ability to cope with it.
author: Dorothy Thompson

prompt: What made me feel content today?
quote: Contentment is not the fulfillment of what you want, but the realization of how much you already have.
author: Unknown

prompt: What left me feeling unfulfilled today?
quote: The only impossible journey is the one you never begin.
author: Tony Robbins

prompt: How did I invest my time today?
quote: Time is more valuable than money. You can get more money, but you cannot get more time.
author: Jim Rohn

prompt: What interrupted my focus today?
quote: Concentrate all your thoughts upon the work at hand. The sun's rays do not burn until brought to a focus.
author: Alexander Graham Bell

prompt: What did I forgive today—myself or others?
quote: Forgiveness is giving up the hope that the past could have been any different.
author: Oprah Winfrey

prompt: What wisdom from today will I carry forward?
quote: The only true wisdom is in knowing you know nothing.
author: Socrates

prompt: How did I make today matter?
quote: The purpose of life is not to be happy. It is to be useful, to be honorable, to be compassionate.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

prompt: What would I tell someone who had the exact same day as me?
quote: Be kind, for everyone you meet is fighting a harder battle.
author: Plato

prompt: What am I looking forward to tomorrow?
quote: Tomorrow is a new day with no mistakes in it yet.
author: L.M. Montgomery
